headline: Dutch Apple Pie with Oatmeal Streusel
description: The crunchy streusel topping on this apple pie adds an extra dimension of flavor and texture. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream for a winning dessert!
name: Dutch Apple Pie with Oatmeal Streusel
recipeIngredient: 5 cups apples - peeled, cored and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Make the apple pie: Place apple slices in a large bowl. Mix white sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice together in a separate bowl until combined; sprinkle over apples and toss until evenly coated.
Remove pie shell from freezer; pour apple mixture into pie shell and dot with butter. Lay a sheet of aluminum foil lightly on top of filling, but do not seal.
Bake pie in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, make the streusel topping: Mix flour, oats, brown sugar, lemon zest, and cinnamon in a medium bowl until combined. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Remove pie from oven and sprinkle streusel on top.

Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Return pie to oven and bake until streusel is browned and apples are tender, 30 to 35 minutes more. Cover loosely with aluminum foil to prevent excess browning.

review.reviewBody: Made to recipe everyone really enjoyed it.
bake pie crust for 5mins prior to filling with apples, increase flour to 3T, added 6 cups apples, omit allspice.
Very good taste very moist would recommend it to other people
Amazing
i didn't like the oatmeal streusel. I think i like it better without the oatmeal.
Came out very good. Im not a big fan of apple pie's, but the streusel topping is a big plus.

I make this pie every year for thanksgiving at the request of my family. It never lasts 24 hours which is saying something given that we are a family of four. I change nothing. The recipe is wonderful as is!
Love this recipe!!
Very delicious!!! Thank you for your awesome recipe!!

This is one awesome pie! 
Yes, I tweaked it a bit after reading a bunch of the reviews: added additional apples, additional flour, additional cinnamon, made my own pie crust, and precooked it 5 minutes before adding apples, and cooked the pie for 50 minutes, but I’m not counting that against the author of this recipe. 
I consider this to be one of the best pies I’ve ever made- it’s THAT good!
This was a hit! I finally found the foundation of a great apple pie with a crum crust. I’ll be making it again real soon

I thought this was a delicious pie! I wanted to make a pie without 2 crusts and I always love the flavor or a streusel plus adding oats makes me feel like it is a little bit healthier. Also, I wasn't sure if I would like the allspice and nutmeg flavors but it was a very tasty pie! 
I did bake about 45 minutes to get the top browned and the apples cooked thoroughly.

It was so easy! I got premade pie crusts that were already set up in the pan, mixed up the ingredients and went to town. I doubled the recipe and made an extra pie to give to my mother and her friends for game night. I didn't add or take away a thing although I did use old fashioned oats because that's what I had -- it was fine. Great recipe!
I've made this purchase. any times sooooo good!

I followed the suggestions from the other bakers. I baked the shell with egg white for 5 min first. I sliced my apples thin. I covered the top with foil for part of the baking time so it didn't get too brown.
Super good pie recipe! We had a bumper crop of pears this year, so I used slightly underripe pears and one apple. I tried the egg white tip and it worked beautifully. Tasted like a yummy apple pie.

I made only one change. I had no rolled oats so used some granola sweetened with honey. This is the best pie I’ve ever made, bar none!!!! Will be making this again and again. The granola swap was delicious, too!!!
My crust did not cook through and my apples were still too firm but it tasted good. I would bake it considerably longer next time.
Exactly what I was looking for!
My all time go to Dutch pie recipe! I use 6 pick lady apples. Yummy!
I didn’t read the comments before making this, so unfortunately I ended up with a soggy crust at the bottom. Will definitely
I love making pies. This was the best Dutch apple recipe ever . I tweaked the topping by adding crushed pecans and it was like having oatmeal cookies on top of an apple pie.
I know now that I prefer apple pie with a double crust. The streusel made it too sweet for me.

So good! I had to bake mine about 15 mins longer. The lemon zest in the crumble is brilliant. Everywhere it said to do 1/2 a teaspoon of cinnamon I used a full teaspoon because I love it. Also I added a table spoon of corn starch to the apples to make sure it all got thick enough. This was the perfect way to occupy my time during the quarantine and my family was super happy about it.

I used 1/4 cup flour because someone suggested it, and the pie was not runny at all. I increased the cinnamon to the apple mixture, because I like a heavy cinnamon flavor. I used a store bought crust. And I did not peel the apples! It made the pie super fast to put together. And so good!
Very good used Splenda instead sugar could not tell the difference

All the apple pie lovers in my family say this is absolutely the best they've ever had. The only thing I changed was using fresh ground nutmeg. I'm not a big fan of nutmeg and have found that fresh ground makes a world of difference in any recipe.
I love this pie recipe. I would leave off the aluminum foil for the second half of baking.
This was my families favorite pie this Thanksgiving.

Great pie! This is my new go-to Apple pie recipe! I didn’t make my crust—I used a store-bought refrigerated crust. I didn’t freeze the crust, either. In fact, I let mine come to room temperature so it wouldn’t break apart while unrolling it. I also substituted a gluten-free flour blend for the AP flour. Thanks for sharing this fabulous recipe!
So much better than canned pie filling pie. The topping is worthy of being its own oatmeal cookie recipe.
Great recipe. My family loved it! I used some gala apples that were getting a little old, also part of a honey crisp. One important change. I cut the sugar to 1/3 cup to mix with the apples.
I added a little extra cinnamon an used apple pie slice instead of the all spice.

I have always made my apple pies with a top crust. I was short on flour and made my pie with this crumble crust. Everyone went crazy about this pie. I have to admit I will probably not make another apple pie with a top crust again.

Put a scoop on top and wow! They do not come any better.
Followed the recipe exactly. Used the egg white trick on the crust, not soggy at all. Turned out great!

I have made this a couple of times now. It is exactly what I was looking for. I have an apple tree, an old fashioned heirloom tree called Early Strawberry. They are wonderful for applesauce but usually cook up too quickly to make a good pie (they make almost an applesauce pie when cooked the recommended time). So I bake this crust beforehand, put my apples in, and top with the streusel. I only cook long enough to brown the streusel and it's perfect! They are a marvelous, tart apple. So good!

I love the flavors! I tried it with fresh grated spices (with a bit more cinnamon than called for) and homemade pie crust and it was out of this world! The lemon zest gives it an extra something.

That said, I had the same issue with the filling being kind of a soup. Some of that may be user error, I could have drained off a little more of the apple juice, but I didn't want to lose too much of the yummy spice mixture.

With a couple adjustments, this could be a permanent favorite.

We made this pie and were pleasantly surprised. I took other reviewers suggestions and put the apples along with the white sugar in a colendar while preparing the crust. There was approximately 1/4 to 1/2 a cup of liquid that would have made for a runny pie. We used a store bought pie crust and as was also suggested by other reviewers, baked the crust for 5 mins after brushing with egg whites. The bottom crust was cooked perfectly. My husband and I have decided that we will never buy an apple pie from the store again. This pie was just too easy to make.

Very good pie. I made some changes. I added an additional 1/3 C of brown sugar and 3/4 tsp salt to the sugar/spice mix.
I added 1/4 C ground walnuts to the topping.
I lengthened initial baking time to 15 mins.
Simple and delicious. I'll be using this pie and topping recipe going forward.
Quite delish! Didn't change a thing. A big hit with dinner guests. Only crumbs were left after everyone had seconds. I will make this again.

Delicious recipe! It was a big hit for our Thanksgiving dessert. The only thing I would change is that the streusel topping was a little dry. I would add another tablespoon of butter to the dry ingredients.

Amazing apple pie!!! I did the egg wash on the frozen crust and it helped. I also used 3 kind of apples - honey crisp, Granny Smith, and a fuji. Everyone loved the pie and said it was the best pie. I was told I will be bringing this to every family gathering from now on.

Great pie recipe. But definitely had to use the egg white trick and bake without filling 10 minutes so the crust doesn't get as soggy on the bottom, as a seasoned pie baker and has adjust baking time (I live 300 feet above sea level and needed 10-15 minutes more without aluminum foil) to get my streusel more crisp and slightly brown. Thanks for sharing!

This is my go to recipe every year for the holidays and everyone loves it. I cut out the allspice, nutmeg and lemon zest and use a pre-made frozen pieshell. I take out a stick of butter and let it soften for the topping before i cut it into the other ingredients.
I just made this pie with Granny Smith apples sliced thinly. Baked the first 10 at 450, the last 45 minutes at 375. The flavor is good, but the apples are still crunchy. Waaaahahaha !

Deep dish Apple w/Spec. Silly, butter. I created this season
Baked w/ granny Smith apples and a oatmeal struessel Dutch crumbled topping. Guaranteed to set u back a few n relax every ache n pain n make all the stress o the day dissapear
This is first pie I have ever made! It was very easy to make and was delicious. Maybe a little too much nutmeg and allspice for me.

Love it! Turned out amazing.
Definitely would recommend it with out a doubt.
Love this recipe
Very delicious pie, simple and easy to make. With a homemade crust, this was delectable!!

I have an apple tree. It is an heirloom tree known as "Early Strawberry" and the apples are ready in mid July. They are tart and tasty for baking except that they are not crispy and soften too fast. The tree was renowned for applesauce and that's mostly what I do because they cook up so fast they usually have applesauce texture in a pie. But I found that if I cook the bottom crust first, put the apples in, and put a Dutch apple streusel top and only bake it long enough to brown the top, it's really good. I used this recipe and it was wonderful. I'm always on a diet, so I used white whole wheat flour, truvia, and splenda brown sugar blend as well as cutting the butter in the topping to 1/4 cup and not putting any in with the apples. It may have been more crumbly than designed, but it tasted great. My husband, who is not dieting, thought so too.

I put together the crust and filling first and had it refrigerate overnight (due to not having time to make the whole thing the next day), and drained off the excess liquid that had collected before baking. There was another review that mentioned it was soggy, this may have been their problem.

I used this with Butter Flaky Pie Crust recipe. (Surprisingly, I baked a Sweet Potato Pie I recipe, and that crust turned out horribly, LOL!) I was actually surprised that I actually like the finished pie. First, the crust did not have the consistency of beef jerky (yay!). I used 2 granny smiths, 2 golden delicious, and 1 gala apple. I had 2 galas, but while I love eating them, after tasting the slices alongside the GS and GD, they didn't have much to offer with regard to taste. The streusel topping mixed up quite well, though I had to add an extra tablespoon or so of butter so the crumbs were big and moistly packed instead of small, loose and dusty-like. I added chopped walnuts. The only thing I wish I added was about 1/2 teaspoon or so of salt to either the filling mix or the crumble. Maybe because I substituted the allspice with cloves/ginger, I thought the flavor lacked in depth. It was sufficiently sweet (I use 1/3 cup white and 1/3 cup brown), but it wasn't really flavorful in an exciting kind of way. I was expecting the tartness of the GS (and lemon bath) to balance out the sugar, so while I wanted to add a pinch of salt, I decided against it. Nevertheless, I actually baked this for a love interest who's suddenly disappeared himself. So it'll be flavored with PURE SPITE, and I will enjoy eating every last piece by myself. For whatever it lacked, this pie is still too good for him. And so am I!

This was really easy and fast to make in a pinch. Everyone absolutely loved it! My father-in-law even asked if he could take the last two pieces home! Of course I said yes (but was secretly wanting more) I guess I’ll just have to make it again!

I left out the zest but made it as written otherwise. Everyone enjoyed it and it will be a repeat at our home. Thanks for sharing.
#Allrecipesallstarscanada
#piday

Excellent apple pie! I cooked it a wee bit differently - placed oven rack on lowest position, preheated to 425, did not freeze the crust, skipped the foil-covered pre-bake and put the streusel-topped pie in the 425 preheated oven and immediately turned heat down to 350 and baked for 1 hour. It's spectacular.

I did not use this recipe to make a complete pie, as I enjoy my grandmother’s pie recipe. I did however use this recipe for the crumb topping to make my basic recipe into a Dutch apple pie verses a traditional 2 crust pie. The crumb topping was a fantastic addition to my pie & I will be using it again in the future!

This is so good. I decided to make it because I love apple pie and apple crisp and this is like a combo of both. I used a mix of fuji and granny smith apples. After reading other's reviews, I used 3 tbsps flour in apple mixture. I also brushed crust with egg white before adding apples. I didn't put crust in freezer and I used a store bought crust. Absolutely the best. Will make many times over. Oh and I also let it rest an hour before slicing just to help it settle a bit and not have liquids run.

Delicious! I made exactly as the recipe said, no changes. It was pretty liquidy, which made it impossible to dish out pieces that were pie-shaped. Even being a little messy in the bowl, once I topped it with a scoop of ice cream it disappeared in under a minute! The juices mix well with ice cream, and my husband made me promise to make this recipe "forever". I bet the juices will solidify a bit overnight, or I could tweak the recipe a bit, but honestly, it tastes AMAZING the way it is. YUM!!!
I didn’t have the lemon so I made without but it turned out perfectly!!!! My husband (his only request for thanksgiving) absolutely loved it!!! Will definitely be making again!!!
I made this for Thanksgiving and I only have one word to say about it.....Delicious! Thank you for sharing!
Amazing says it all for this pie! I did not make any modifications.
Absolutely amazing! The only change I made was painting the crust with egg whites (rather than freezing). New family favorite. Will definitely make again!

I followed this recipe to a T, except for omitting lemon zest and adding a bit of cornstarch to the apple mixture. Other reviewers mentioned using tapioca starch as a thickener but I didn't have any. The pie looked and tasted great; however, it was super watery. When I sliced the pie it was all soupy and the bottom crust essentially washed away. This was rather disappointing, thank goodness I didn't make it for guests. The good news is, it tastes great and I'm just going to pretend I made an apple crisp.

I followed this recipe to a T, except for omitting lemon zest and adding a bit of cornstarch to the apple mixture. Other reviewers mentioned using tapioca starch as a thickener but I didn't have any. The pie looked and tasted great; however, it was super watery. When I sliced the pie it was all soupy and the bottom crust essentially washed away. This was rather disappointing, thank goodness I didn't make it for guests. The good news is, it tastes great and I'm just going to pretend I made an apple crisp.

I loved it. I pre baked the pastry until it was brown before filling. I always do this and find the crust doesn't get soggy. My family wanted more apple so I will increase the Apple by 1 cup next time. I found the recipe didn't require any other thickener but the flour. I was careful to mix the apples and flour until they were completely combined before adding to the crust.. I think how much apple or thickener needed depends on how much the apple you're using cooks down while baking. This pie was a cross between a pie and a crisp. I found I had to explain this to my family.

My family LOVED this recipe. I made two of them. I used Fuji and Granny Smith apples. I made the first half of the recipe - minus the crumble topping- in the am. Let them cool and put them in the fridge to finish later in the evening. They turned out perfect... 
It is my husbands new favorite dessert.
I added a little less oatmeal, but i'm sure it would've been great w/the 3/4C. my husband and I love it. (not passed tense) cuz we're eating it now. YUM!

This is a very tasty pie. The crumb tops it off apples were tender. They should have told people to let it sit and cool before you cut into it. If you don't it will be like liquid.. Mine turned out good.

I use this recipe just for the streusel topping to make apple crisp. I use oat flour instead of regular floor to make it gluten free and it comes out perfect every time. This is one of my favorite dishes to make in the fall or when I have a lot of apple lying around.

Fantastic!! I used the suggestion others posted to pre bake my frozen pie crust with egg white. I thought they the pic was way to high up but then realized that it worked out perfectly. I used gala apples ( discount apples bag from Kroger) This turned out absolutely fantastic and it was not runny and wet at all.i sliced the apples very thin and this made them cook evenly. Also don't forget to have ice cream it's a must!

There must be something wrong with me. EVERY recipe that calls for struesel topping makes SO much of it - I always have WAY too much of it when I follow the recipe. But I faithfully follow the recipe every time! Duh!! half of it didn't fit on the pie!! - We'll see how it turns out. I hope I don't have the soggy mess that lots of other cooks have. I swear I don't even know why I bother with others recipes!!

We all loved this pie!! Except for the lemon zest. It was way too overpowering, so much so that we ended up just eating the bottom half and just nibbling at the top. And I always make my cinnamon measurements on the extremely heavy side, so it was very good that way. Also, I didn't freeze my crust, and it turned out fine, just had to cook a little longer for the topping to brown.
Amazing Apple pie. One of my favorites

I've been making homemade pies since I was in 4th grade. This is one of the best apple pies we've ever made. It set up really well so it looked great on the plate. I loved the flavor and texture. I didn't add butter or allspice and made my usual crust. Other than that, we followed the recipe.
I omitted the oatmeal and cut down on spices to show only cinnamon. It was awesome!!
Love it will make again
I made as written except with no bottom crust. The topping was a bit soggy for our liking. Was looking for something more crumbly. Next time I will use less flour and butter
The flavour was wonderful, but the pie was to soft, it was more like apple crumble. The dessert was enjoyed by everyone though.
Great easy recipe! It was a hit with all for dinner.
Absolutely delicious! Hubby even wanted me to make it again for his birthday yesterday. I did let apples cook a little longer before putting crumble on top.
Excellent! Try it if its still a little warm!!
I DIDNT CHANGE ANYTHING. IT REMINDED ME OF MY GRANDMOTHERS TASTE JUST LIKE HERS. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE RECIPE.
We thought this pie was delicious !
Love the streusel

I made this for my boyfriend. I bake a lot, but I've not made many pies. This tasted very good. Instead of store bought, I made a crust from this site. The filling was a little watery. I may add a bit more flour next time, but I will make it again.

I didn't stray away from the recipe but I did do a few things differently when it came to the freezing/baking. Also, a lot of comments are excluding the lemon zest but I thought it was an awesome touch to the topping. This was my first homemade pie and it turned out amazing!

1. I lightly brushed the crust with a beaten egg white and did not freeze it.

2. I let it bake longer than it called for and always with the aluminum foil on top until the last 10 minutes to give it a little crunch. I had the pie/topping in the oven for about 20 minutes extra. That caused the extra liquid to cook off and the apples were perfectly done.
Amazing! I upped the flour to 3 tbsp in the apple mixture based on reviewer's suggestions. Served with vanilla ice cream. Turned out perfect and everyone loved it!
It is amazing! I would definitely recommend this recipe to anyone. I used a graham cracker crust and it went perfectly with the pie.
I took the suggestions from others adding the extra flour and cutting the apples really thinly and it worked out perfectly. It tasted so good it was gone in one day.
Followed the recipe exactly and the filling was very liquidy - like soup!
Turned out great! Used a full 1/4 cup of flour for the apple mixture as suggested by other reviewers and so glad I did. Made for a perfect pie!
Apples were under cooked. The topping was dry and crumbly.

The mistake I made was on the struessel topping. Make sure your butter isn't overly soft. I forgot to take mine out of the fridge to soften and put it in the microwave on defrost for a few seconds. It seemed ok until I added it in. It made the strussel more of a dough rather than crumbly. However, I was still able to put it on top. It hardened while it baked and still turned out awesome. Two other things i changed were: I let my pie crust thaw out before baking and I also baked my pie for 45-50 mins. Not 35. But this recipe is on point! So yummy!

This was exceptional! I followed another reviewers suggestion of adding a heaping tablespoon of Tapioca to the apple mixture, as well as, brushing the crust with egg whites, letting it dry and then baking for 5 minutes before adding the apple mixture and baking. (I didnt freeze it.) The crust came out perfectly, not soggy at all. I used granny smith apples and the combination of tart and sweet was perfectly balanced. I will absolutely make this again using these same suggestions. Delish!
Made it as written and it was fabulous. Baking time was longer than noted in the recipe. Slice apples very thinly to get that stacked look and to be sure that they bake correctly.

Made this for my family - Christmas Eve dinner. It received 5 stars from everyone! I took the advice for the crust and brushed with a beaten egg white and baked it for 7 minutes @ 375. I also cooked the Granny Smith apples (used about 10 or 11 medium sized & sliced thin) in a heavy iron skillet for 5 minutes then added the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg mixture but used 2 tbsp tapioca instead of flour and cooked another 10 minutes. Added Apple filling, baked for 10 minutes, then put the streusel topping on and baked for 25 min. with foil placed on top. I allowed the pie to cool for several hours to allow juices to set before cutting. Served w/ vanilla ice cream.
It was delicious! Because I was making two pies, I doubled most of the ingredients, but not the butter. Still super good!

I've made is pie three times now and everyone is asking to make it as a new holiday tradition. It's easy to make, even for beginners like me. It's sooo good it will make you look like a professional pastry chef.

I made a few tweaks after the first pie. I used instant apple cranberry oatmeal which gives it a slight tang and emphasizes the apple flavor in the topping. Also try the filling with a touch of ground cloves. I also did not freeze the crust and increased the initial cooking time mixture to about 12 minutes. Lastly, I sliced the apples thinly and layered them evenly in the plate to make sure they evenly cooked through.

item.name: Dutch Apple Pie with Oatmeal Streusel
